author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm, Josh Grant gives a look at what it takes to develop and publish a game in Fortnite by building a first-person shooter payload game from scratch.

From an empty project all the way to the publishing stage, you’ll be surprised how easy it is to stand up a game by yourself. 

Josh breaks down each step along the way, including rapid prototyping of game logic and level design, building immersive environments, setting up custom UI, creating retentive game loops, and making attractive thumbnails. 

There’s no better time than now to learn how to develop your game in Unreal Editor for Fortnite (UEFN)!

Learn more about UEFN here: unrealengine.com/uses/uefn-unreal-editor-for-fortnite

#GameDevelopment, #FirstPersonShooter, #UnrealEditorForFortnite, #UEFN, #Fortnite, #UnrealFestStockholm
title: Developing Your Next Game with UEFN | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
This session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm shows how to leverage Unreal Engine alongside Varjo's native multi-app capabilities and future OpenXR extensions to build sophisticated, layered simulations. 

Learn how to seamlessly integrate outputs from diverse engines and image generators, controlling the final view through prioritized rendering, where higher priority applications overlay lower priority ones.  

Explore practical applications like merging detailed Unreal cockpits with dedicated terrain generators for advanced training; overlaying interactive design elements onto existing virtual scenes using markers; or running analytics like eye tracking concurrently with primary visual applications. 

The session covers techniques for incorporating real-world elements using video passthrough and custom chroma key masking, creating powerful mixed reality training environments (e.g., compositing a real cockpit into a virtual world). Finally, the session addresses the crucial performa
title: Multi-App Compositing With Unreal Engine, OpenXR, and Varjo | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
Watch this video to see Sandfall Interactive’s Tom Guillermin discuss how he got started with Unreal Engine, and the role UE5 played in developing GOTY candidate ‘Clair Obscur: Expedition 33’. 

Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 is a compelling turn-based RPG that defied the odds by becoming one of the most well-reviewed and commercially successful titles of 2025, racking up numerous accolades in the process—including a record-breaking 12 nominations at The Game Awards in categories such as Best Game Direction, Best Role Playing Game, and even Game of the Year.

In this interview, we explore how Guillermin got started and how the evolution of Unreal Engine coincided with the growth of the team at Sandfall. We also dive into how key UE5 features such as Nanite, Unreal Insights, and Blueprint visual scripting impacted development for the growing team.

#ClairObscurExpedition33, #SandfallInteractive, #TheGameAwards, #GOTY, #UnrealEngine, #UE5, #Nanite, #UnrealInsights, #BlueprintVisualScriptin
title: Clair Obscur: Expedition 33 | Developer Interview | Unreal Engine

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm, Bojan Andrejek describes how blackcode SA builds cutting-edge configurator systems for high-end watches, including a cinematic, real-time experience powered by Unreal Engine 5 and designed for the watchmaker's showroom. 

With these advanced configurators, customers can fully personalize their watch with over 70 dynamic elements including dials, bezels, straps, and engravings. 

The system supports real-time lighting, live material changes, and a dual-camera system (manual and automated), creating a premium digital twin of each configuration.

Watch to explore techniques for building modular configurator systems with scalable architecture for in-store and online use; gain insight into synchronizing Unreal Engine with cloud services, local content syncing, and cross-platform deployment strategies; and find out how to use Unreal Engine as a high-fidelity frontend for commerce, configurators, and enterprise applications beyond games.

Le
title: Digital Watchmaking: Advanced Real-time 3D Configurators for Luxury | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025

author: Unreal Engine
description:
In this session recorded at Unreal Fest Stockholm, we take a look at the new features of the improved GPU profiler that shipped with UE 5.6, and how the extra information it provides can help when profiling titles for both CPU and GPU performance. 

We also take a deep dive on our modern RHI submission pipeline design. This system is responsible for the threading of renderer work on the CPU, and feeding that work to the GPU. 

Watch to learn about the modern Unreal Engine renderer threading design, which is valuable when analysing Unreal Insights traces for rendering related performance issues.

Learn more about Unreal Engine here: unrealengine.com

#GPUProfiler, #RHISubmissionPipeline, #UnrealInsights, #UnrealEngine, #UE5.6, #UnrealFestStockholm
title: New GPU Profiler and RHI Submission Pipeline | Unreal Fest Stockholm 2025
